programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A look at cases where people have claimed that strange voices have urged them to commit horrific deeds, and an analysis of whether they could have been obeying the orders of aliens.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.sub-title: Voyage to the Bottom of the Cenote
programme.desc: After making a potentially historic find in the Money Pit area, a massive and mysterious cave-in threatens brothers Marty and Rick Lagina and their team with disaster.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Things get physical between Dan and Dave when the desert heat sets tempers on edge, while Ivy plays it cool bidding on a high-risk locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy and Mary enter into an unusual alliance when the gang hits Koreatown, and Brandi steps into a classic 1980s movie when Jarrod finds a Tron costume.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A Santa Ana auction has the buyers hoping for a high-class score, while Jarrod and Ivy battle between buying sprees leaving the other bidders reeling.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hope auctions in the California college town of Rancho Dominguez will land them big money. Mary decides to explore her mean side, while Darrell and Brandon look for more bargains.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Tension grows between Melvin and Leland, Browning gambles on a new team member, and Shelby risks everything he owns as he heads further into the swamp.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Following an ill-fated road trip, Jimmy and James work in the dangerous black water of the American South, but realise they are out of their depth.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man sells Seth some Detroit Red Wings memorabilia, but Les feels that the money offered was too much and some of the items he purchased are just for him and not for resale.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les question Ashley's skills of diplomacy after observing her interact with several customers.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Investigating beliefs held by some experts that many atmospheric light shows are actually caused by extraterrestrials.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts assess the possibility that alien invaders could opt to destroy life on Earth rather than attempt to enlighten mankind.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Reported accounts of genuine alien encounters, with specific regard to the so-called flying saucer, which has become synonymous with UFO terror.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Alien Files Unsealed investigates recently-released documents regarding alien and UFO encounters, made accessible to the public in 2011 by the Freedom of Information Act..

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Alien Files Unsealed investigates recently-released documents regarding alien and UFO encounters, made accessible to the public in 2011 by the Freedom of Information Act..

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts try to uncover the truth about alien remains by investigating reports of extraterrestrial bodies recovered from crashed UFOs.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A look at the world's hottest UFO zones, where physical and paranormal phenomena, unidentified objects and aliens are reported with alarming frequency.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Investigating evidence that suggests the world's governments could be on the verge of announcing everything they know about UFOs.

programme.title: Inside Area 51's Secrets
programme.desc: Underground tunnels, hidden enemy aircraft, secret government UFO files... After years of silence, Area 51 insiders spill their secrets for the first time and reveal what's really been going on inside the most secretive place on Earth..

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Strange objects above Sweden, a UFO over Portugal and an extraordinary 'mass-sighting' of strange luminous phenomena in a remote Italian village.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto searches for and tests several possibilities that may explain the mystery and phenomena of Superhuman strength.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zach sets out to research the strangest creatures from the depths of the ocean and to see how much they lend to the monsters of myth and legend.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto explores the scientific causes of sinkholes and what they mean for the future of the planet.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto talks to experts in the world of artificial intelligence and investigates Facebook's AI project, which was shut down in 2017.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto tackles the ultimate existential question as he explores what happens when people die and whether or not there is life after death.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Unknown objects, weird lights and a shocking criminal investigation - check out Scotland's Livingston UFO, Norway's Hessdalen lights and Portugal's Castelo de Bode Dam encounter.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While monitoring the dangerous collapse at H8, the team conducts a test that could lead them straight to the Money Pit.

programme.title: America's Greatest Prison Breaks
programme.desc: An account of the breakout of escaped killers Richard Matt and David Sweat from Clinton Correctional Prison in New York, as it was investigated by US Marshals and other officials.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry, including handing an item of clothing to a cyclist.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: David Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the quiz from November 2018, with Andy Hamilton and Deborah Frances-White joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Joe Lycett, Phil Wang and Ellie Taylor join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig looks at the pastimes of past times. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Sliced
programme.desc: Comedy set amongst the hustle and bustle of a low-rent, backstreet pizza parlour, following the adventures of delivery riders Joshua (Samson Kayo) and Ricky (Theo Barklem-Biggs). It's all change at Sliced, as mercurial manager Mario hires new girl Naomi to join the team. Joshua falls head over heels in love with her but things get held up when he encounters a rather challenging customer.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Lorraine Kelly and Dara O Briain join David Mitchell's team while Barry Cryer and Sue Perkins are captained by Lee Mack, on the panel game where contestants try to fool their opponents into mistaking fact for fiction and vice versa. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Ed Gamble, Milton Jones and Nish Kumar join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: Rebecca Jackson and Elo help a buyer find an environmentally-friendly car, with options including a 968 Fiat 500 with a wicker-basket boot and two electric cars.

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: A woman wants a luxury car upgrade, with top of the range parking capabilities and folding wing mirrors, which proves difficult for Elo's classic car suggestions.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The amateur race arrives into Valkenburg aan de Geul in the Netherlands, traditionally the finish of the Amstel Gold Classic cycling race.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Strongman Eddie meets - and eats - gators roaming the Everglades, tests his grappling skills with WWE legends The Headbangers, and tries to devour a kitchen sink full of ice-cream.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie visits the Garden State for supersized breakfast in a New Jersey diner, a tryout with ice hockey pros the NJ Devils - and an epic struggle with an eight-hot-dog challenge.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Highlights of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's adventures trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for precious objects.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: A look back at the biggest items Mike and Frank ever picked. Picking was easy - getting the behemoths home was the hardest part.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites stand-up comedian Phil Wang, actor Stephen Mangan and comedian and comedy writer Holly Walsh to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include soap opera The Archers, having a bath and making friends with an aerobics instructor.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites singer Geri Horner and comedians Katherine Ryan and Adam Buxton to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include phone calls, pens that fail to work properly and marathons.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and musician Bill Bailey, actress Una Stubbs and radio presenter Alice Levine to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include taramasalata, people who talk too loudly and drama cliches.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Comedian and actor Miles Jupp, chef extraordinaire Heston Blumenthal, actress Emilia Fox and funnyman Ed Byrne are this week's guests.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that may be the truth or may be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are comedians Rhod Gilbert and Hal Cruttenden, interior designer and former Dragons' Den investor Kelly Hoppen and TV host and number-cruncher Carol Vorderman.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs divulge what sound like tall tales about themselves, before their rival contestants decide whether they are lying. Greg Davies takes Lee Mack's place as guest captain, and joining him and David Mitchell are choir leader Gareth Malone, Sherlock actress Amanda Abbington, comedian and Buzzcocks panellist Phill Jupitus and Pointless co-host Richard Osman.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian Jimmy Carr, writer Steven Moffat and singer Rochelle Humes to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include sandy beaches, other people's opinions and being Scottish.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites Line of Duty star Vicky McClure, comedian and writer Sandi Toksvig and comedian and presenter Josh Widdicombe to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include real ale, hotel leaflets and coat hangers.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and writer Roisin Conaty, footballer-turned-pundit Chris Kamara and comedian and actor Nish Kumar to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include bread at restaurants, downloading music and ex-partners.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Featuring all the thrills and spills from the 2013 Red Bull Soapbox Race in London, as the crews unleash their four-wheeled, motorless creations on a challenging downhill course littered with obstacles.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Matt Lucas, Holly Walsh and Susan Calman join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig opens her post in a post-themed edition. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Actor Mackenzie Crook, wildlife presenter Chris Packham, writer and broadcaster Victoria Coren Mitchell and comedian Rhod Gilbert join David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with odd personal statements that may or may not be true.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Lorraine Kelly and Dara O Briain join David Mitchell's team while Barry Cryer and Sue Perkins are captained by Lee Mack, on the panel game where contestants try to fool their opponents into mistaking fact for fiction and vice versa. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Ed Gamble, Milton Jones and Nish Kumar join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry discover which of them is this series' winner.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a strange formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off Florida.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: War Above the Trenches
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary about the Royal Flying Corps, recreating the aerial struggle of the First World War based on the personal accounts of pilots.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The spies who worked during the American Civil War, including Elizabeth van Lew, whose effective network even smuggled out messages in hollow eggs.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The award-winning documentary series reveals how the end of the Second World War resulted in Britain's military and economic exhaustion, leaving Europe at the mercy of sparring superpowers as the Cold War era dawned. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Jeremy Isaacs' classic documentary explores the Second World War's powerful legacy. For many people the conflict was the most significant experience of their lives, but it also left millions dead - ordinary civilians and victims of persecution, as well as military casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Churchill's Secret Son
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of Tipperary-born businessman and Conservative cabinet minister Brendan Bracken, who became Winston Churchill's right-hand man during the Second World War by opposing efforts to appease Adolf Hitler. The film considers the possibility of a biological connection between the two men.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals why male seahorses give birth, and looks at how hyena packs are dominated by the female members.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how fleas are able to jump great distances for their size and attempts to discover how fast a cheetah can run.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores animals that have developed tool-making skills to help them survive, including orangutans and crows.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines animals that are able to expand their bodies, including anacondas and camels.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals the unusual ways in which flamingoes and blue whales eat, examining the ways feeding patterns have influenced both species' behaviour in similar ways.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The surprising preventive and curative 'medicine' developed by certain species, including the hippopotamus, which secretes a red slime to act as a highly efficient sun screen.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Two families with remarkable powers of regenerating unusually large body parts easily - salamanders, which do so when a large chunk, such as the tail or a limb, has been bitten off by a predator, and male moose, which grow and shed antlers every year.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals why male seahorses give birth, and looks at how hyena packs are dominated by the female members.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how fleas are able to jump great distances for their size and attempts to discover how fast a cheetah can run.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores animals that have developed tool-making skills to help them survive, including orangutans and crows.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines animals that are able to expand their bodies, including anacondas and camels.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals the unusual ways in which flamingoes and blue whales eat, examining the ways feeding patterns have influenced both species' behaviour in similar ways.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The surprising preventive and curative 'medicine' developed by certain species, including the hippopotamus, which secretes a red slime to act as a highly efficient sun screen.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Two families with remarkable powers of regenerating unusually large body parts easily - salamanders, which do so when a large chunk, such as the tail or a limb, has been bitten off by a predator, and male moose, which grow and shed antlers every year.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of guitarists taken from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Includes electric performances by Carlos Santana, Mark Knopfler, Peter Green and the Edge, and acoustic material by John Martyn, John Renbourn, Bert Jansch and Paco Pena.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of 1970s-era axe-men, acoustic virtuosos and thumping riff merchants, in a compilation of guitar-heavy performances from the BBC TV archives. Guitar gods including Jimi Hendrix, Pete Townshend, Peter Green and Johnny Winter are joined by, among others, flamenco maestro Manitas De Plata, bottleneck bluesman Ry Cooder and straight-up rockers AC/DC and Thin Lizzy. Plus, Fleetwood Mac, the Jam and Be Bop Deluxe and Nils Lofgren.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Status Quo play Pictures of Matchstick Men on Top of the Pops in 1968, the Who perform Long Live Rock in the Old Grey Whistle Test studio, Dire Straits deliver Tunnel of Love and Lynyrd Skynyrd bring a taste of the American South with Sweet Home Alabama. The programme also features rare performances from George Benson, Leo Kottke, Link Wray and Tom Petty.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Including electric performances by the Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, David Bowie, Motorhead, Nazareth, AC/DC and George Thorogood, as well as acoustic material by Michael Chapman, Horslips and Paco de Lucia.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The body of 20 year-old Lorna Katz is discovered drifting in the River Lea, with evidence suggesting she was tied up somewhere before she floated downstream. However, the death takes on an ever-more sinister significance when the team discovers that Lorna was the best friend of Ruth Tresize, a teenager who disappeared three years previously, with the missing girl's mother Ali becoming fixated on Nikki for information, convinced that the two incidents are connected.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The pretender exposes King Henry's weaknesses, while Lizzie confronts new demons and old curses. Concluding the sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages as the War of the Roses comes to an end. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates an arson attack on a 1980s music station that resulted in the death of a controversial DJ, and looks into the subsequent suicide of the station's owner. Strickland seeks a permanent replacement for the absent Halford, but Pullman and Standing call his bluff.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh's world is turned upside down after Harriet gives birth to their baby, while Meryl and Ajax clash over his plans for a cemetery on the family farm.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry tracks down the paedophile who abused him as a child and, enraged by the old man's lack of remorse, resorts to physical violence. Yvonne tries to stop pregnant teenager Shirley selling her baby, but her well-meaning intervention has unexpected and potentially tragic consequences. Debbie learns her nanny has been hiding a shocking secret and Phil consoles Samantha, who is now convinced her missing daughter Abi has been abducted.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani fears Terry has taken the law into his own hands when both he and Malcolm Willard go missing, but it seems the aged paedophile has more to fear from Terry's brother Ben, who is also looking for revenge. Irene Radford issues dire threats after her son Wayne is found dead in his cell, apparently from an overdose, while Neil reprimands Andrea for breaking regulations - only to end up in a passionate embrace with her.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Things look grim for Adam as the day of his trial dawns, until Andrea and Neil manage to expose Jerome Taylor's dirty dealings, while investigations into the death of paedophile Malcolm Willard raise the alarming possibility that a serial sniper could be on the loose in Sun Hill. An angry exchange with Shirley adds to Yvonne's woes as she anxiously awaits the results of her HIV tests.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jack questions the wisdom of Adam's decision to alert the officers to the presence of a serial sniper on the streets of Sun Hill, while undercover journalist Andrea debates whether to cave in to pressure from her editor and deliver a sensationalistic story that could terrify the local population. Steve is unimpressed with Lance's handling of a hostage situation and resorts to extreme measures to express his displeasure.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to re-create a Victorian garden in Regent's Park, where they meet all manner of intriguing characters - but the oasis of calm in central London is shattered by the discovery of a body. The victim is a respected Harley Street psychiatrist - whose three-legged dog appears to hold the key to solving the case. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Annie (1982)
programme.desc: An orphan wins the fatherly affections of a tough-talking billionaire - but the no-good owner of the orphanage and her brother are out to ruin the girl's chances of happiness and make a quick profit in the process. Musical, directed by John Huston, based on the stage play. Starring Aileen Quinn, Albert Finney, Carol Burnett and Tim Curry.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A woman expecting her third child realises she cannot afford to care for her baby, so makes the painful decision to give it away to her wealthy but childless cousin. Shelagh befriends the woman in the next hospital bed and Dr Turner confides in Timothy about his worst fears. Sister Julienne looks for a new recruit to join the midwives, and the community prepares to celebrate the opening of a new park.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A distant cousin of Fred's who has Down's syndrome is taken in by the Buckles following the death of his protective mother, but Violet struggles to cope and Shelagh is forced to make other arrangements for his care. New recruit Valerie prepares for her first day at Nonnatus House, and Trixie comes to the aid of a pregnant woman who is in urgent need of dental treatment to avoid an infection. The nurses discover what has happened to Sister Mary Cynthia, a revelation that has distressing consequences for Sister Monica Joan.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: While the world anxiously awaits the resolution of the Cuban Missile Crisis, Valerie treats a pregnant Somali woman who has undergone female genital circumcision. The Nonnatus Team arrange for her to go into hospital, but she responds by going into hiding, and the situation is complicated further when it emerges that the woman's younger sister will soon go through the same process. Sister Mary Cynthia's depression is treated with electroconvulsive therapy, which she hopes will restore her faith.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner is reunited with a couple whose daughter was born without limbs, and takes them to a specialist unit where she can be fitted for prosthetics. However, while the experience helps the girl's mother to realise that she is not alone, it proves traumatic for the father, who blames his wife for his child's condition. Nurse Crane takes charge of Sister Winifred's driving lessons, and Trixie thinks Christopher is hiding something from her.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A body is discovered in a vineyard and Father Brown is tasked with searching for the murderer among a group of suspects who are all seeking to reinvent themselves. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A scientist studying a live volcano is found dead halfway up the mountain, and the evidence points to a heart attack. Humphrey is convinced one of the dead man's colleagues murdered him - an unlikely possibility, since they all have alibis. Away from the investigation, the inspector eagerly awaits Martha's return to the island, while JP settles into married life and Dwayne makes an error of judgment while talking to a journalist. Kris Marshall, Josephine Jobert and Danny John-Jules star in the sun-soaked whodunit, with guest appearances from Douglas Hodge, Natasha Little and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Father and son Bill and Frankie McAteer are killed in an apparent car accident on their way home from work at Billingsgate Market, but Nikki and Jack arrive to discover the younger man's body is riddled with bullets. Back at the Lyell centre, Clarissa summons her husband Max, a digital forensics expert, to help crack the case - and he uncovers disturbing video evidence showing a sexual encounter between Frankie, his girlfriend Becky and best friend Liam. Crime drama, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: Cape Fear (1991)
programme.desc: A psychopathic rapist is released from prison after 14 years and plots revenge on the defence attorney he blames for his imprisonment. Subjecting the lawyer and his family to a terrifying campaign of intimidation, he uses his knowledge of the law to stay untouchable. Martin Scorsese's thriller remake, starring Robert De Niro, Nick Nolte, Jessica Lange and Juliette Lewis, with cameo appearances by Gregory Peck, Robert Mitchum and Martin Balsam, who all appeared in the 1962 original.

credits.actor: who all appeared in the 1962 original

programme.title: Animal Mums
programme.desc: How young animals copy their mother to learn new skills that are vital to keep them a live in the wild, including cheetah cubs learning how to hunt, with Liesl Eichenberger of the Sanbona Reserve in South Africa explaining the different stages of hunt school. Gorilla researcher Eva Maria Luef reveals the different gestures used to beg for food from their mother and initiate play, while Ellen Jackson at a stud farm in Sacramento talks about the close bond between horse foals and their mother, and how they learn to socialise and run with the herd. Narrated by Hugh Bonneville.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: When two space freighters crash in low-earth orbit, Alan and John must evacuate the hot-headed pilots from a dangerous debris field.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz tests a ray that makes people dance. Magoo, wearing a snorkelling mask he's convinced is a virtual reality gaming headset, mistakes the ray for a weapon..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Thinking he's on an Arctic expedition while actually at the beach, Magoo mistakes Fizz for a monkey, definitive evidence of global warming..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Thinking he's fixing Weasel's coffee maker, Magoo tweaks Fizz's teleporter, the invention that the hamster plans to exhibit at the innovation tradeshow..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood films. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: The Sara Cox Show
programme.sub-title: The Sara Cox Show at Christmas
programme.desc: Sara is joined by actors Robson Green and Sarah Parish, and comedian Luke Kempner, while chef Tony Singh cooks up some tasty New Year nibbles.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: Juliet is joined by chef Merrilees Parker, who serves up a range of party food for New Year's Eve, including baby baked canape potatoes filled with smoked mackerel pate.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Lisa Faulkner makes chicken liver pate and homemade melba toast, while John Torode prepares a beef Wellington with dauphinoise potatoes and cauliflower cheese - with a difference.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha and chef Mark Sergeant prepare a New Year feast, featuring a 'full Spanish' for breakfast, roasted poussin for lunch and a foolproof beef Wellington.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present the launch show for the 12th series of the skating challenge. The famous faces taking part this year are magician Ben Hanlin, reality TV star Maura Higgins, Diversity member Perri Kiely, model and businesswoman Caprice, TV presenter Trisha Goddard, actress Lisa George, Paralympian Libby Clegg, ex-EastEnder Joe Swash, Steps singer Ian 'H' Watkins, newsreader Lucrezia Millarini, and former footballer Kevin Kilbane. Also appearing here is TV personality Michael Barrymore, although a broken wrist suffered after the recording of this programme has ruled him out of the main show, and he is replaced by former Blue Peter host Radzi Chinyanganya. In this first edition, the celebrities are paired up with their professional partners, while Torvill and Dean also perform a spectacular routine with some special guests, before taking to the judges' desk alongside Ashley Banjo and newcomer John Barrowman.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.sub-title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs at Christmas
programme.desc: The comedian helps out at Battersea Dogs & Cats Home over the festive period, where he is enlisted to help pooches with behavioural problems. They include a reclusive mongrel that refuses to leave its kennel and a grumpy Yorkshire terrier that refuses to walk. Paul also helps an overprotective staffie mum struggling to say goodbye to her pups and an excitable one-year-old puppy that just cannot stop having little accidents. He also gets out and about with the street vets to bring festive joy to London's homeless and their dogs.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a special festive edition of the quiz. Sports presenter Clare Balding, actor Stephen Mangan and Coronation Street's Catherine Tyldesley each sit in the hot-seat, hoping to win 1million for their chosen charities, and as usual they will have four lifelines to help them along the way - Ask the Audience, 50:50, Phone a Friend and Ask the Host.

programme.title: Tenable All Stars
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts as a celebrity team from the world of politics take on the Tenable Tower. Ann Widdecombe, Edwina Currie, John Sergeant, George Galloway and Lembit Opik must join forces as they attempt to win 125,000 for their charities.

programme.title: Quizmaster
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine pits previous contestants of Britain's toughest quiz shows against each other in a bid to discover who is the greatest of all time. The 15 players have achieved success on shows including Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? Mastermind, The Chase, Fifteen to One and University Challenge, and will compete across high-octane quiz rounds.Each one sees contestants eliminated until just two remain to go head-to-head in the final.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Russell Kane, Leonie Elliott, Kevin Clifton and Bonnie Langford pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Torvill & Dean
programme.desc: One-off drama following Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean's humble beginnings and family life in Nottingham, and how they came together to forge an ice-dancing partnership that would see them secure their place in sporting history with 12 perfect 6.0s at the 1984 Winter Olympics for their famous Bolero routine. Will Tudor and Poppy Lee Friar star as the duo, with Stephen Tompkinson, Anita Dobson, Dean Andrews, Jaime Winstone, Christine Bottomley, Annabelle Apsion and Jo Hartley.

programme.title: Knocked Up (2007)
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents-to-be decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: How did pictures from the Hubble telescope make the comet of the century look like an alien spacecraft? Has earth already been invaded by alien organisms?.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Looking at the mysterious trails on the lunar surface near the Apollo landing sites, as well as a strange space object.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: Al, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Phill Jupitus and Kerry Godliman, oversees a battle between The Builders Arms from Teddington and The Newsroom from Edinburgh.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Criminals try to outrun the law and a man attempts to get into a fight with the driver of a giant freight truck.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage demonstrates what happens when a dog gets behind the wheel. Plus, rowdy races gone wrong, and an incredible dance-off on the highway.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A collision on a racetrack results in a multi-car pile-up, houses are swept away by floodwaters, a man is sucked into a jet engine, and an F1 powerboat takes off.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of a gas leak that triggers a fireball. Plus, a daredevil crashes his all-terrain vehicle during a back-flip, and a pilot-less plane plunges towards a crowd.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton travels the world to view vehicles and memorabilia worth buying and restoring. In the first edition, the larger-than-life Londoner gets his hands on a 70-year-old Volkswagen Schwimmwagen - an amphibious car that he test-drives through a lake at a country fare.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and the team revamp Frederick's Pontiac Lemans, which has been neglected because of his financial situation.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers behind Drew Pritchard's antiques empire save an iconic Eames lounge chair. They also revive an unusual 90-year old oil lamp and a glamourous steam trunk.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard's artisan restorers rescue a ravaged carousel horse dating from before the First World War. Plus, they revive a valuable 1930s sofa and a 100-year-old weathervane.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team of experts tries to restore three family heirlooms and treasured possessions to their former glory, working on a clock, a carving of a flying fish and an accordion.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Will Kirk restore a piano stool, clock restoration expert Steve works on a vintage telephone and antique projector specialist Richard Rigby enlivens a magic lantern.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Will Kirk restore a prized Davenport desk which was damaged by burglars, and Steve Fletcher tackles a tricky time-travelling conundrum.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A firefighting historian restores an antique helmet, a Victorian garden gnome is returned to its original condition and a treasured musical box is mended before the owner finds out.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Resident ceramicist Kirsten Ramsey painstakingly puts the broken bits of a shattered vase by Jean Lurcat, a contemporary of Picasso's, back together again. A precious 19th-century Italian chair and a very special jewellery box are also restored. Narrated by Bill Paterson.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a painting, a ceramic plaque and a Japanese lacquered jewellery box.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores two Royal Worcester vases that are precious family heirlooms, along with a Cirencester village clock and a 19th-century hay press.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team works to restore a clapping monkey toy, an ornate Victorian travelling treasure box, and an iconic 1950s Wurlitzer jukebox.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Restorers get to work on a grandfather clock, hoping to make it chime again, and doctors perform surgery on a teddy bear with only one ear and one arm after a run-in with a puppy.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A 100-year-old Nordic rocking chair that its owner's grandparents were given on their wedding day is restored. A mother of pearl shell and a ceramic bulldog are also redeemed.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a Victorian cuckoo clock, a 1970s bowl and a 200-year-old sea chest.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Painting conservator Lucia Scalisi faces a serious challenge when presented with a perforated painting by celebrated British artist Fred Appleyard.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Experts try to restore family heirlooms and treasured possessions to their former glory in time for Christmas. Among the items is a Victorian version of a jukebox called a Polyphon, that has rusted into silence. It moves sisters Ann and Kathryn to tears when they hear it play the family's favourite carol for the first time in decades.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The restorers face a challenge with Chesterfield sofa rescued from the scrapheap. Plus, they set out to revive a shattered marble figurine and a broken French bakery counter.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The restoration team transforms a shabby set of apothecary drawers, refreshes a French Victorian seat and saves a 1960s chandelier that witnessed a Beatle's wedding.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers revive a rare and valuable fairground ride, then resuscitate a Victorian park bench and a century-old gentleman's suitcase.

programme.title: When Dinosaurs Roamed
programme.desc: How newly discovered fossils found in America have provided scientists with evidence of previously unknown species and helped fill a 30-million-year gap in the continent's prehistory. State-of-the-art computer technology takes viewerd back to a time when the prehistoric giants were the kings of land, air and sea.

programme.title: Swimming with Monsters with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist travels to the sea of Cortez to study and swim with the voracious Humboldt squid - but risks being dragged into the abyss by its deadly tentacles.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Birmingham City v Leeds United and Sheffield Wednesday v Cardiff City.

programme.title: Are We Alone?
programme.desc: Scientists compare the extreme environments of distant worlds with those found in remote areas of Earth, in the hope of gaining new insights in the search for extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: My Shocking Story
programme.desc: The life of John Brandon, who at 5ft 6 and 28 stone is struggling to live his life and contemplating a major surgical procedure to help improve matters.

programme.title: 28 Stone Teenager - One Year Later: Shocking Story
programme.desc: An update on the progress of John Brandon, who underwent major surgery in an attempt to lose weight.

programme.title: My Fat Saved My Life
programme.desc: Four surprising stories about people who survived dangerous situations thanks to their fat. On occasion, the most unlikely hero is the extra weight some people carry around with them.

programme.title: Obese and Expecting
programme.desc: Documentary following four morbidly obese pregnant women as they suffer health crises and relationship breakdowns, all while striving to deliver healthy babies.

programme.title: 42 Stone Mum: One Year Later
programme.desc: A revisit to Dominique Lanoise, the mother-of-six who became housebound due to her ongoing weight gain. The progress she has made toward her goal of a normal life is revealed.

programme.title: The 685lb Teen
programme.desc: Justin Williamson is the most overweight teenager in the US and everyday life is tough. However, he has two goals - to get healthy and launch a singing career. This is his story.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Stephanie wants to kick off Christmas with a Black Friday wedding, while Katie is hoping to look like an ice princess for her winter wonderland ceremony.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride gets help choosing a dress from her favourite celebrity.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A basketball player plans to wear an unusual outfit for her wedding, but her friends are determined to get her into a traditional dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Two Montes Are Better Than One
programme.desc: A bride's son is just as fashion-conscious as Monte and has a few ideas about his mother's dress, while another customer wants a vintage dress that matches her cowboy boots.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride Jaye is eager to try on wedding gowns for her big day, but is shocked to find her sister has taken her place on the runway.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: A Little Sparkle Goes a Long Way
programme.desc: YouTube star BFFTaylor won't feel satisfied with her dress until her mother cries. Meanwhile, Olympian bride Kellie Wells must make a tricky choice.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Are You Ready to Play Bridal Blitz?
programme.desc: A bride agreed to marry her fiance after only six weeks of dating - but it has already taken longer than that for her to choose a dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride wants to get married in a black dress, but her parents would prefer something more traditional. A plan to customise a 100-year-old dress does not go to plan.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Eager grooms accompany their fiancees on the hunt for dresses, and a former customer receives sad news when her engagement is broken off.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The consultants face a trying situation when a socialite comes in to collect a $20,000 dress she designed herself, only to have second thoughts about it.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kate finds herself torn between two dresses when she visits the store to pick out something special for her renewal ceremony.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The brutally honest assessment of her twin sister leaves future bride Vicky struggling to pick a gown, while a mother and daughter come in for a double fitting.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: We Don't Need Anything from Them Besides Love
programme.desc: Two brothers navigate a painful past as they search for their family. Their journey reopens decades-old family mysteries. Hosted by Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: She Just Drove Off and Never Returned
programme.desc: Lisa Joyner meets a woman who was left on a curb by her mother when she was four years old. Now, she is desperate to find her parent to understand why.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Lisa's struggle with weight worsened after witnessing her brother's murder. Now bedridden, she must lose the weight or never see her grandchildren grow up.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: This special documentary focuses on the lives of four pairs of conjoined twins, who manage to lead a remarkably normal existence despite their condition.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A teacher who cries crystals, a woman with brittle bones, a prematurely aged teenager and a boy with butterfly skin.
